item.title: This Is Not A Hubble Photo Of A Supernova -- It's Food
item.description: Ajay Malghan makes a living by playing with food and taking pictures of it. He cuts a thin slice of carrot, kiwi or any other fruit, presses it in between two glass sheets and experiments with light, colours and proportions. The result are these awesome abstract pictures. More »
item.dc:creator: Omar Kardoudi
item.content:encoded: Ajay Malghan makes a living by playing with food and taking pictures of it. He cuts a thin slice of carrot, kiwi or any other fruit, presses it in between two glass sheets and experiments with light, colours and proportions. The result are these awesome abstract pictures. More »

item.title: Impressive Photo Of Hundreds Of Flying Rays Is One Beautiful Nightmare
item.description: This photograph of a large school of mobula rays by Eduardo Lopez Negrete is one of the entries for the 2014 National Geographic Traveller Photo Contest. Keep in mind that these majestic creatures can reach a 5.2m wingspan and weigh over 1000kg. It may look like a nightmare, but they are harmless. More »
item.dc:creator: Jesus Diaz
item.content:encoded: This photograph of a large school of mobula rays by Eduardo Lopez Negrete is one of the entries for the 2014 National Geographic Traveller Photo Contest. Keep in mind that these majestic creatures can reach a 5.2m wingspan and weigh over 1000kg. It may look like a nightmare, but they are harmless. More »

item.title: Space Station Astronaut Sees Missiles Exploding On Gaza
item.description: German astronaut Alexander Gerst reports live with this photo of Gaza from the International Space Station. This is his description. “My saddest photo yet. From #ISS we can actually see explosions and rockets flying over #Gaza & #Israel” More »
item.dc:creator: Jesus Diaz
item.content:encoded: German astronaut Alexander Gerst reports live with this photo of Gaza from the International Space Station. This is his description. “My saddest photo yet. From #ISS we can actually see explosions and rockets flying over #Gaza & #Israel” More »

item.title: Nightmare Porcelain Figures For Evil Grandmas
item.description: It seems that Danish artist Maria Rubinke makes classic porcelain in the greatest European tradition — until you see the gore details and blood over them. They would be perfect for your grandmother — if she were a vampire, a werewolf or a psychopath. More »
item.dc:creator: James Baker
item.content:encoded: It seems that Danish artist Maria Rubinke makes classic porcelain in the greatest European tradition — until you see the gore details and blood over them. They would be perfect for your grandmother — if she were a vampire, a werewolf or a psychopath. More »

item.title: Huge Chocolate Mill Reveals Delicious Changing Geometry As You Shave It
item.description: This huge chocolate mill — created by Studio Wieki Somers and chocolatier Rafael Mutter for a retrospective on the Dutch architect Gerrit Rietveld — reveals intricate geometrical designs as you rotate the sharp metal arm that shaves it one millimetre at time. It cements my conviction that all art should be edible and delicious. More »
item.dc:creator: Jesus Diaz
item.content:encoded: This huge chocolate mill — created by Studio Wieki Somers and chocolatier Rafael Mutter for a retrospective on the Dutch architect Gerrit Rietveld — reveals intricate geometrical designs as you rotate the sharp metal arm that shaves it one millimetre at time. It cements my conviction that all art should be edible and delicious. More »

item.title: I Wish I Could Spend Summer In The Mediterranean Driving This Beauty
item.description: Italian designer Pietro Russomanno‘s Raceline is the 8m long daughter of a classic Riva boat — one of my favourite vehicle designs — and a classic sports car. If I had to spend a summer in the Mediterranean riviera, this is the vehicle I’d like to have to move from coast town to coast town to eat seafood and drink Martinis. More »
item.dc:creator: Jesus Diaz
item.content:encoded: Italian designer Pietro Russomanno‘s Raceline is the 8m long daughter of a classic Riva boat — one of my favourite vehicle designs — and a classic sports car. If I had to spend a summer in the Mediterranean riviera, this is the vehicle I’d like to have to move from coast town to coast town to eat seafood and drink Martinis. More »

item.title: Making Hot Air Bread Balloons With An Industrial-Strength Blower
item.description: Here is the most fun way to make bread: prepare a massive pile of dough, brightly coloured with natural dyes; cut off a small section and flatten it out; place that pizza-like sheet on top of an industrial-strength blower and watch it inflate into a toasty, instantly edible balloon. More »
item.dc:creator: Jordan Kushins
item.content:encoded: Here is the most fun way to make bread: prepare a massive pile of dough, brightly coloured with natural dyes; cut off a small section and flatten it out; place that pizza-like sheet on top of an industrial-strength blower and watch it inflate into a toasty, instantly edible balloon. More »

item.title: Guy Splits Bullet In Two Firing It Against A Machete, Hits Two Targets
item.description: According to the Rated RR guys, this is the most difficult trick in the world: Fire a bullet against a machete and split it in two hitting two targets. They didn’t only do it once — but twice in a row. And then once more, shooting backwards using an iPad as a mirror to aim. More »
item.dc:creator: Jesus Diaz
item.content:encoded: According to the Rated RR guys, this is the most difficult trick in the world: Fire a bullet against a machete and split it in two hitting two targets. They didn’t only do it once — but twice in a row. And then once more, shooting backwards using an iPad as a mirror to aim. More »

item.title: Augmented Reality Climbing Walls Turn Mountaineering Into A Game
item.description: There are lots of reasons to tackle a climbing wall at your local gym: it’s great exercise, it can improve your hand-eye coordination, and it helps instill useful mountaineering skills should you ever find yourself trapped on a cliff. But researchers at Aalto University in Finland want to take them one step further through the use of Kinect sensors and projectors that turn climbing walls into interactive games. More »
item.dc:creator: Andrew Liszewski
item.content:encoded: There are lots of reasons to tackle a climbing wall at your local gym: it’s great exercise, it can improve your hand-eye coordination, and it helps instill useful mountaineering skills should you ever find yourself trapped on a cliff. But researchers at Aalto University in Finland want to take them one step further through the use of Kinect sensors and projectors that turn climbing walls into interactive games. More »

item.title: This Aussie-Made Pregnancy App Is Meant For Guys
item.description: Who’s Your Daddy? That’s the name of an Australian-made pregnancy app that’s meant to help out first-time dads with everything they need to know about their partner’s pregnancy. More »
item.dc:creator: Luke Hopewell
item.content:encoded: Who’s Your Daddy? That’s the name of an Australian-made pregnancy app that’s meant to help out first-time dads with everything they need to know about their partner’s pregnancy. More »

item.title: A Self-Powered Bike Trailer That Pulls All Of Its Own Weight
item.description: They’re a cheaper and often less stressful way to get around a big city, but compared to a car, bikes kind of suck when it comes to hauling cargo. A trailer certainly helps if you’re willing to put in the extra effort needed to haul it, but there’s now a better solution. Someone’s created a self-propelled bike trailer that makes it feel like your bicycle is pulling nothing at all. More »
item.dc:creator: Andrew Liszewski
item.content:encoded: They’re a cheaper and often less stressful way to get around a big city, but compared to a car, bikes kind of suck when it comes to hauling cargo. A trailer certainly helps if you’re willing to put in the extra effort needed to haul it, but there’s now a better solution. Someone’s created a self-propelled bike trailer that makes it feel like your bicycle is pulling nothing at all. More »

item.title: UNSW's Sunswift Solar Car Smashes A World Land Speed Record
item.description: Another one for the record books! The Sunswift eVe solar car, put together and maintained by the University of New South Wales’ dedicated engineering team, has just smashed a 26-year-old electric land speed record at a track in Victoria. Once the world’s top motorsports governing body signs off, that is.. More »
item.dc:creator: Campbell Simpson
item.content:encoded: Another one for the record books! The Sunswift eVe solar car, put together and maintained by the University of New South Wales’ dedicated engineering team, has just smashed a 26-year-old electric land speed record at a track in Victoria. Once the world’s top motorsports governing body signs off, that is.. More »

item.title: A Triptych That Proves Portrait-Oriented Video Isn't Always Horrible
item.description: Usually, we are very much against shooting video with your phone in portrait orientation, because it looks like rubbish for the most part. But Dan Toth did something we never thought of, using three portrait-oriented videos to make a lovely triptych of his neighbourhood in Sunnyside, Queens. More »
item.dc:creator: Robert Sorokanich
item.content:encoded: Usually, we are very much against shooting video with your phone in portrait orientation, because it looks like rubbish for the most part. But Dan Toth did something we never thought of, using three portrait-oriented videos to make a lovely triptych of his neighbourhood in Sunnyside, Queens. More »

item.title: Can Someone Please Stop Microsoft From Doing Whatever The Hell It Calls This, Please?
item.description: Video: Oh God. Please stop, Microsoft. Please. More »
item.dc:creator: Luke Hopewell
item.content:encoded: Video: Oh God. Please stop, Microsoft. Please. More »

item.title: North Korea Launched A Bizarre New Cooking Website 'For Housewives'
item.description: Refusing to let little things like a lack of widespread internet/food access get in its way, everyone’s favourite warmongering-dictatorship-that-could has just launched its very own cooking website. Say hello to North Korea’s uncanny online food valley. More »
item.dc:creator: Ashley Feinberg
item.content:encoded: Refusing to let little things like a lack of widespread internet/food access get in its way, everyone’s favourite warmongering-dictatorship-that-could has just launched its very own cooking website. Say hello to North Korea’s uncanny online food valley. More »

item.title: Here's A Poster For The Next Instalment Of 'The Hobbit'
item.description: Image Cache: So they’re still making those Hobbit movies, eh? I can get behind that, I guess, especially when the poster is as epic as the one that’s just been released for the latest instalment. More »
item.dc:creator: Luke Hopewell
item.content:encoded: Image Cache: So they’re still making those Hobbit movies, eh? I can get behind that, I guess, especially when the poster is as epic as the one that’s just been released for the latest instalment. More »

item.title: Finally, A Pair Of Sunglasses That Will (Hopefully) Never Break
item.description: If you’re prone to breaking sunglasses just hours after you’ve bought them, hold off on ordering a bunch of replacements in bulk until you can try the I-Ultra sunglasses from Italia Independent. They’re made of stiff but forgiving rubber — everything except the lenses — so they will require quite a bit of effort to destroy, not just an accidental fall to the ground. More »
item.dc:creator: Andrew Liszewski
item.content:encoded: If you’re prone to breaking sunglasses just hours after you’ve bought them, hold off on ordering a bunch of replacements in bulk until you can try the I-Ultra sunglasses from Italia Independent. They’re made of stiff but forgiving rubber — everything except the lenses — so they will require quite a bit of effort to destroy, not just an accidental fall to the ground. More »

item.title: Watch This iPhone 5s Get Obliterated By A Train
item.description: There’s not much that can survive being hit by a train. Not even an iPhone. Turns out that when you lay one down on the tracks to become freight train fodder, it ends really badly. More »
item.dc:creator: Luke Hopewell
item.content:encoded: There’s not much that can survive being hit by a train. Not even an iPhone. Turns out that when you lay one down on the tracks to become freight train fodder, it ends really badly. More »

item.title: Monster Machines: America's Next Big Space Launch Rocket Is A Total Beast
item.description: With its forthcoming Space Launch System, NASA hopes to send astronauts farther into space than it ever has ever before — to Mars and beyond. And when the first crew does leave to make interplanetary history, they will do so aboard these rocket engines. More »
item.dc:creator: Andrew Tarantola
item.content:encoded: With its forthcoming Space Launch System, NASA hopes to send astronauts farther into space than it ever has ever before — to Mars and beyond. And when the first crew does leave to make interplanetary history, they will do so aboard these rocket engines. More »

item.title: Tiny Gold Nanomotors Spin 10 Times Faster Than A Race Car Engine
item.description: Nanomotors are an amazing feat of engineering: tiny gold rods less than a micrometer long, powered by ultrasonic waves to spin at crazy-fast speeds. How fast? Scientists just figured out a way to measure, and it’s astonishing: 150,000 RPM, 10 times faster than the fastest race car engine. More »
item.dc:creator: Robert Sorokanich
item.content:encoded: Nanomotors are an amazing feat of engineering: tiny gold rods less than a micrometer long, powered by ultrasonic waves to spin at crazy-fast speeds. How fast? Scientists just figured out a way to measure, and it’s astonishing: 150,000 RPM, 10 times faster than the fastest race car engine. More »
